content:
The Marineford Arc is the twenty-second story arc of the manga and anime One Piece, 
and the fourth story arc of the Summit War Saga.

The arc begins with the World Government preparing for the execution of Portgas D. Ace, 
son of the Pirate King Gol D. Roger. Fleet Admiral Sengoku reveals Ace's true parentage 
to the world. Edward Newgate, known as Whitebeard and one of the Four Emperors, leads 
his crew and allied pirate crews to save Ace from execution at Marine Headquarters.

section: Calm Before the Storm - Ace's Secret Revealed
content:
Ace is revealed to be the son of Gol D. Roger. Sengoku announces this shocking revelation 
to all Marines and the world. Whitebeard declares he will save Ace no matter what. The 
Three Admirals (Aokiji, Kizaru, and Akainu) prepare for battle along with the Seven 
Warlords of the Sea. Mihawk, Doflamingo, Hancock, Kuma, and Moria stand ready.

section: WAR! Whitebeard Pirates vs. Marine Headquarters
content:
The battle begins with Whitebeard's forces attacking Marineford. Little Oars Jr., a giant 
pirate, charges forward but is severely wounded by the Marines. Whitebeard demonstrates 
his Devil Fruit power, the Gura Gura no Mi (Tremor-Tremor Fruit), creating massive 
earthquakes and tsunamis. The Three Admirals work together to stop the tsunami using 
their Devil Fruit powers.

section: The Bet on the New Age - Luffy and Whitebeard
content:
Monkey D. Luffy arrives at Marineford after escaping from Impel Down with a group of 
dangerous criminals including Crocodile, Jinbe, Ivankov, and Mr. . Luffy declares he 
will save his brother Ace. Whitebeard recognizes Luffy's straw hat as the one Shanks 
used to wear. Luffy's heritage as the son of Revolutionary Dragon is revealed by Sengoku. 
Luffy unleashes Conqueror's Haki unknowingly, knocking out many Marines and pirates.

Through combined efforts of Luffy and the Whitebeard Pirates, Ace's execution is stopped. 
Mr. uses his wax powers to create a key and unlock Ace's seastone handcuffs. Ace and 
Luffy fight side by side against the Marines. Whitebeard orders his crew to escape with 
Ace while he holds off the Marines.

section: The Sacrifice for a Younger Brother
content:
Akainu provokes Ace by insulting Whitebeard. Unable to tolerate this, Ace stops to 
confront Akainu. When Akainu attacks Luffy with a magma fist, Ace jumps in front to 
protect his brother. Akainu's Magu Magu no Mi (Magma-Magma Fruit) burns through Ace's 
fire defense. Ace's internal organs are destroyed by the magma. In his final moments, 
Ace thanks everyone for loving him despite being Roger's son and dies in Luffy's arms 
with a smile.

After Ace's death, Luffy suffers a complete mental breakdown. He becomes catatonic and 
unable to process the trauma. Jinbe carries the unconscious Luffy while fleeing from 
Akainu's pursuit. This traumatic event fundamentally changes Luffy.

Whitebeard, enraged at Ace's death, attacks Akainu with devastating power. Despite 
suffering multiple wounds including having half his face burned off by Akainu's magma, 
Whitebeard continues fighting. He declares that the One Piece is real, reigniting the 
Great Pirate Era with his final words. Whitebeard dies standing upright, never showing 
his back to an enemy. His body bore sword wounds, bullet wounds, and 
cannonball wounds.

Marshall D. Teach (Blackbeard) arrives with his crew after Ace's death. Using his Yami 
Yami no Mi (Dark-Dark Fruit) powers, Blackbeard somehow extracts Whitebeard's Gura Gura 
no Mi ability and claims it for himself. This makes him the first person in history to 
possess two Devil Fruit powers simultaneously.

As the war spirals into chaos, Shanks, one of the Four Emperors, arrives at Marineford. 
His presence stops the war immediately. Shanks blocks Akainu's magma attack and declares 
he will be anyone's opponent if the fighting continues. The Marines agree to cease fire. 
Shanks ensures proper burials for Whitebeard and Ace.

Marine Koby stands up to Admiral Akainu, pleading for the meaningless fighting to stop. 
Shanks praises Koby's courage, saying his few seconds of bravery changed the fate of 
the world.

The death of Whitebeard creates a massive power vacuum in the New World. Blackbeard 
emerges as a major threat with two Devil Fruits. The balance of the Three Great Powers 
(Marines, Warlords, and Four Emperors) is shattered. Many territories previously 
protected by Whitebeard fall into turmoil. Luffy's bounty reaches million berries.

section:
The Wano Country Arc is the longest arc in One Piece, featuring the alliance between 
the Straw Hats, Law's crew, the Minks, and the samurai of Wano attempting to take down 
two Yonko
content: Kaido and Big Mom.

Luffy's group reads about the Levely while sailing to Wano. The crew comes to a stormy 
area that looks like a massive waterfall. They must ascend to reach Wano Country.

Luffy, Zoro, and the others arrive in Wano Country, a nation closed off from the rest 
of the world. They discover a polluted wasteland where clean food and water are scarce. 
The people suffer under the tyrannical rule of Shogun Kurozumi Orochi and Kaido. Luffy 
meets O-Tama, a young girl who dreams of becoming a kunoichi and joining Ace's crew.

Kin'emon reveals the history of Kozuki Oden, former daimyo of Kuri and Wano's rightful 
shogun. Oden sailed with Whitebeard and then Gol D. Roger, learning the true history of 
the world. Twenty years ago, Oden was executed by Kaido and Orochi after being boiled 
alive for an hour while holding his retainers. His famous quote "I was born to boil!" 
represents his indomitable spirit.

Luffy is captured and sent to the Prisoner Mines in Udon, where prisoners build weapons 
for Kaido. In prison, Luffy meets Eustass Kid and an old man named Hyougoro. Luffy 
begins training to master advanced Armament Haki (Ryuo) under Hyougoro's guidance.

Charlotte Linlin (Big Mom) washes ashore in Wano with amnesia. She befriends O-Tama 
and the villagers of Okobore Town. When Big Mom regains her memories and learns that 
Queen ate all the oshiruko (red bean soup), she becomes enraged and attacks Udon prison. 
This chaos allows Luffy and the prisoners to take over the prison.

section: The Fire Festival and Onigashima Raid
content:
The alliance prepares to raid Onigashima during Kaido's Fire Festival. Kanjuro is 
revealed to be a traitor working for Orochi. He kidnaps Momonosuke and escapes. The 
alliance's ships head to Onigashima for the decisive battle.

section: Battle on Onigashima - The Raid Begins
content:
The Straw Hats and their allies infiltrate Kaido's fortress. Luffy encounters the 
Tobiroppo (six strongest Headliners) and Kaido announces he is searching for his son 
Yamato. Big Mom forms an alliance with Kaido, creating an unprecedented threat.
Yamato, Kaido's daughter who identifies as Kozuki Oden, helps Luffy and the alliance.

section: She possesses the Mythical Zoan Inu Inu no Mi, Model
content:
Okuchi no Makami (divine wolf). 
Yamato has advanced Conqueror's Haki and carries Oden's journal containing crucial 
information about Joy Boy and the true history.

section: The Emperors vs. The Worst Generation
content:
On the rooftop of Onigashima, Luffy, Zoro, Law, Kid, and Killer face Big Mom and Kaido. 
The battle showcases the highest level of combat in One Piece. Luffy awakens advanced 
Conqueror's Haki coating, allowing him to infuse his attacks with Conqueror's Haki and 
fight on equal footing with Kaido.

Simultaneous battles rage across Onigashima. Zoro faces King the Wildfire and masters 
Enma, obtaining Conqueror's Haki infusion. Sanji battles Queen the Plague, awakening 
his Germa modifications and manifesting Ifrit Jambe (blue flames). Nami and Usopp 
defeat Ulti and Page One. Robin overcomes Black Maria using Demonio Fleur. Franky 
defeats Sasaki in a mech battle. Jinbe takes down Who's-Who.

section: Law and Kid vs. Big Mom
content:
Trafalgar Law and Eustass Kid team up to battle Big Mom. Law uses his awakening 
techniques K-Room and Puncture Wille, extending his sword to pierce through Onigashima. 
Kid demonstrates his awakening by turning Big Mom into a magnet and crushing her with 
metal structures. Together they push Big Mom off Onigashima, where she falls into a 
magma chamber and is defeated.

:
During the final battle with Kaido, CP interferes and allows Kaido to strike down 
Luffy. Everyone believes Luffy is dead. However, Luffy's Devil Fruit awakens, revealed 
to be the Mythical Zoan Hito Hito no Mi, Model: Nika - the Sun God. Luffy transforms 
into Gear , gaining cartoon-like properties and ultimate freedom. His body turns white 
with steam clouds, and he can turn his surroundings into rubber.

Zunesha, the ancient elephant, declares that Joy Boy has returned after years. 
Momonosuke can hear Zunesha's voice. The Gorosei and Im-sama react with alarm to 
Luffy's awakening, recognizing the legendary fruit they've been seeking for centuries.

section: Luffy vs. Kaido - The Final Battle
content:
With Gear 's power, Luffy matches and surpasses Kaido. Their battle showcases cartoon 
physics combined with devastating power. Luffy grabs lightning bolts, turns into a 
giant, and fights with pure joy. The final clash between Luffy's Bajrang Gun and 
Kaido's Flame Dragon Torch ends with Luffy's victory, sending Kaido deep underground.

Momonosuke, aged to by Shinobu's Devil Fruit power, uses his dragon abilities to 
carry Onigashima on flame clouds, preventing it from crushing the Flower Capital. He 
overcomes his fear and declares himself Kozuki Momonosuke, future Shogun of Wano.

With Kaido's defeat, Orochi is also killed. Wano is finally liberated after years 
of oppression. Momonosuke is declared the new Shogun. The citizens celebrate their 
freedom and Luffy's heroism.

After the battle, Luffy's bounty increases to billion berries, and he is officially 
recognized as one of the Four Emperors (Yonko). Law and Kid also receive billion 
berry bounties each. The Straw Hat Grand Fleet totals over , members.

The Straw Hats, Kid Pirates, and Heart Pirates prepare to leave Wano. Law declares 
their alliance has ended and they are now rivals in finding the One Piece. Yamato 
initially wants to join the Straw Hats but decides to stay in Wano temporarily to 
protect it, mirroring Oden's journey. Momonosuke and Kin'emon say farewell as the 
pirates depart.

The Enies Lobby Arc is the sixteenth story arc of One Piece and the third story arc 
of the Water Saga. The Straw Hats arrive at Enies Lobby to rescue Nico Robin and 
Franky from the World Government's CP.

The Straw Hats, Sogeking (Usopp in disguise), the Franky Family, and Galley-La 
shipwrights arrive at Enies Lobby aboard the Rocketman train. Enies Lobby, also known 
as the Judicial Island, is one of the World Government's three major strongholds, 
featuring perpetual daytime and over , troops.

Luffy encounters CP agent Blueno on the courthouse roof. Unlike their previous 
encounter, Luffy reveals his new Gear ability, which allows him to pump blood through 
his body at high pressure for increased speed and power. His body emits steam and turns 
pink. Luffy easily overpowers Blueno with this new technique.

The crew finally learns Robin's tragic history. Twenty years ago, Robin's homeland 
Ohara was destroyed by a Buster Call for studying the forbidden Void Century. Robin, 
only eight years old, was the sole survivor and labeled the "Demon Child" with a bounty. 
She spent her life betraying and being betrayed, never finding a place to belong.

section: Declaration of War on the World Government
content:
In one of One Piece's most iconic moments, Luffy orders Sogeking to shoot down the 
World Government flag flying above the Tower of Justice. This act symbolizes the Straw 
Hats officially declaring war on the entire World Government. Luffy shouts to Robin: 
"Say you want to live!" Robin breaks down and screams, "I want to live! Take me out to 
sea with you!"

The CP agents reveal they each have a key, and only one will unlock Robin's seastone 
handcuffs. The Straw Hats must defeat all of CP to be sure they have the right key. 
Spandam, the cowardly CP leader, drags Robin toward the Gates of Justice.

section: Straw Hats vs. CP - Individual Battles
content:
Each Straw Hat faces a CP member in intense one-on-one battles. These fights push 
every crew member to their limits and showcase their growth.

Rob Lucci is the strongest in CP's history with a power level (Doriki) of ,. He 
possesses the Cat-Cat Fruit Model: Leopard and masters all six Rokushiki techniques 
(Soru, Geppo, Rankyaku, Shigan, Tekkai, Kami-e). His philosophy of "Dark Justice" views 
killing as necessary duty. The battle pushes Luffy to his absolute limits.

Zoro faces Kaku, who recently ate the Giraffe Zoan fruit. Despite the awkward-looking 
form, Kaku proves incredibly dangerous by combining his assassination sword style with 
Rankyaku air slashes. During this fight, Zoro develops his Asura technique, manifesting 
an illusion of nine swords and three heads. His final attack, Asura: Ichibugin, 
overwhelms Kaku.

Sanji battles Jabra, who possesses the Wolf Zoan fruit and uses Tekkai Kenpo (moving 
while using iron body defense). Sanji creates Diable Jambe, where he spins at high 
speed to heat his leg until it glows red with flames. This technique allows his kicks 
to burn through opponents' defenses. His finishing move defeats Jabra decisively.

Nami faces Kalifa, who ate the Awa Awa no Mi (Bubble-Bubble Fruit), creating bubbles 
that weaken enemies by making them smooth and powerless. Using her Perfect Clima-Tact, 
Nami unleashes Mirage Tempo to confuse Kalifa before defeating her with Thunder Lance 
Tempo.

Chopper eats three Rumble Balls in succession, transforming into an uncontrolled 
monster that dwarfs the tower. In this berserk state, he defeats Kumadori but loses 
consciousness afterward, unable to remember his actions.

Franky battles Fukurou after getting a cola refill from Chopper. Super-charged with 
cola, Franky uses his various cyborg weapons and defeats Fukurou with Coup de Vent, a 
powerful air cannon from his arms.

Sogeking (Usopp) shoots down the World Government flag from an incredible distance atop 
the Tower of Justice. Later, he shoots keys to Franky from the same distance, a feat 
that amazes even the Marines who admit they cannot match such sniping skill.

Spandam accidentally activates a Buster Call by using the Golden Den Den Mushi. This 
summons ten battleships, five Vice Admirals, and devastating firepower capable of 
annihilating entire islands. The same attack destroyed Ohara years ago, making it 
deeply traumatic for Robin.

:
In his battle with Lucci, Luffy reveals Gear , where he bites his thumb and inflates 
his bones to giant size. This creates devastating attacks like Giant Pistol and Giant 
Axe. However, after using Gear , Luffy shrinks to chibi size proportionally, leaving 
him vulnerable.

Franky receives all five keys from the defeated CP members. Using the Number key, he 
successfully unlocks Robin's seastone handcuffs. Freed from her restraints, Robin uses 
her Hana Hana no Mi powers to attack Spandam, breaking his spine.

The brutal battle between Luffy and Lucci spans multiple locations. Despite taking 
life-threatening damage, Luffy refuses to fall. The emotional weight of protecting 
Robin drives him beyond his limits. With a final barrage of Gear Jet Gatling attacks, 
Luffy defeats the strongest CP agent in history.

As the Buster Call fires on the remaining crew, a familiar voice calls out. The Going 
Merry, despite being left destroyed at Water , miraculously appears to rescue everyone. 
The ship's Klabautermann (ship spirit) pilots Merry one final time, telling them to 
return to the "sea of adventure."

Sanji closes the Gates of Justice, creating whirlpool currents that help them escape. 
The crew uses Luffy as a slingshot to deflect cannonballs. Robin breaks Spandam's spine 
with her powers. Franky uses Coup de Vent to catapult the ship to safety.

After escaping the Buster Call, the Going Merry apologizes for not being able to carry 
them further. The crew gives Merry a Viking funeral, burning the ship while thanking 
her for everything. Merry's final words - "I was happy. Thank you for taking such good 
care of me" - bring tears to the entire crew. This moment treats Merry as a true nakama 
rather than just a ship.

Following the arc, the Straw Hats' bounties increase dramatically. Luffy reaches 
million berries, Zoro gets million, Sanji receives million, Robin increases to 
 million. First-time bounties appear for Franky ( million), Nami ( million), 
Chopper ( berries - mistaken for a pet), and Usopp ( million as Sogeking). The 
entire crew is now considered a serious threat to the World Government.

Franky, a cyborg shipwright and student of the legendary Tom who built Roger's ship, 
joins the Straw Hats. He burned Pluton's blueprints during the arc. Franky's dream is 
to build a ship that can sail to the end of the world, aligning with Luffy's journey.

The arc centers on nakama (companionship) and what one would sacrifice for friends. The 
Straw Hats risk everything - their dreams, lives, and futures - to save Robin because 
she's their companion. Robin's cry "I want to live!" represents choosing to trust others 
and accepting your own worth despite past trauma. The arc argues that everyone deserves 
to live and find their place in the world.
